website_summaries.verdict: Recommended by physical therapists and also versatile in use.
pros: Consistent padding creates an ideal rehabilitation device that works especially well for those healing from knee problems
Adapts easily to your current lifestyle whether utilized when watching television or working out
Great for improved balance as well as stretching
cons: Can feel a bit stiff for some

customer_reviews.title: It will not last.
customer_reviews.text: I dislike the fact that the pad did not retain its shape beyond about 6 months. My teenage grandson used it daily in sitting at his desk. He also did balance type exercise by standing on it. This he did at most one day each week. Now it looks and feels like a hard pancake.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Kent

customer_reviews.title: ... was delivered on time and the product quality was fine as well
customer_reviews.text: The item was delivered on time and the product quality was fine as well. At the same time this is not what I expected. The pad is definitely "firm" and not soft. I originally used one (not this exact pad or manufacturer) at my physical therapists office and their pad was soft and it was also a challenge to keep balanced...If you have extreme balance issues then this item is probably very good. Either way I am just showing 3 of 5 stars because if I read the other posts I would have known that this item is "firm"....Great delivery, great quality etc but I wanted a softer balance pad that is more of a challenge.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt Baker

customer_reviews.title: walking/stepping on a series of 3 in a row of them is a good
customer_reviews.text: I've been recovering from a bout of sciatica and one of the main symptoms was a loss of feeling in my right foot and leg and subsequently a loss of balance. After spinal decompression therapy, I am recovering and walking on these really has helped me me to regain my sense of balance (a work in progress). Be sure you have something to hang onto when beginning. They look simple but truly test your balance. walking/stepping on a series of 3 in a row of them is a good workout
customer_reviews.author: Philip Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: Must have for any physical therapy clinic
customer_reviews.text: I am a physical therapist in an outpatient clinic and use this all the time at the to help patients with balance exercises and rehabilitating leg injuries. It is great for people of all levels of physical fitness as there are dozens of exercises that can be done on this foam pad.
customer_reviews.author: Abe

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful stability trainer pad
customer_reviews.text: Bought to use in a commercial gym. It arrived quickly. The pad fits my 6'5" client very well. He uses it to do "sissy" squats on. Balance training is very important to him. This was the best way to increase the challenge of his sissy squats without risking a fall. The pad has held up well, however my clients are very respectful with equipment. The pad consists of 3 foam pads of different density sandwiched together. Exterior of the pad is a non slip surface. Some clients use this as a pad when they do stretching or exercises on the floor. 10/10 would recommend
customer_reviews.author: BlK  C4t

customer_reviews.title: Good Amount of Firmness
customer_reviews.text: We use this in our physical therapy clinic and I loved it so much, I had to have one for my house. I use this for so many purposes. I do stretches on the floor using this so that my knees aren't directly on the floor. It's also nice for sitting on when you need some extra cushioning. It's very firm and I know it holds its firmness for a long time because of the ones we use at the clinic. You could also use this as a balance pad while standing on one foot.
customer_reviews.author: JuJoDuDo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for push ups
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for pushups from your knees. I’m working up to full push ups and to start, I’m doing it on my knees. With this foam square I’m able to kneel without a hint of discomfort. At 2.5 inches thick it cushions me well, others out there were 1.5” thick and I don’t think I’d go that thin. I got the larger one so I could have my knees spaced about the width of my shoulders which are pretty broad even for a guy. The texture is grippy without being tacky or sticky. The foam doesn’t have a chemically smell and is attractive looking. One thing I’ll need to find out is if when I’m really sweaty if I’ll slip any.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, high quality, very handy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a balance pad to use at home. I have used similar ones in physical therapy and at the Pilates studio. Maintaining good balance is especially important as we get older. It is so simple to just stand on this once a day - one foot at a time for 30 seconds. Also, it is very handy just to use as a nice pad when I need to get on my knees to get something out of a low cupboard in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Chaunie L

customer_reviews.title: you'll feel it but better yet, your ankles will get strong
customer_reviews.text: Another brand was at least $10 more and is exactly the same. I had a severe sprained ankle and my chiropractor suggest this to help strengthen my ankles. Seems simple up but it is actually very unstable and will strengthen all the little muscles in your calf and ankles. Try just standing on one foot for 30 seconds to start..you'll feel it but better yet, your ankles will get strong. Take it from a runner who has sprained her ankles maybe 5 times each throughout my life....as a matter of fact, I just got back to writing this review and twisted my ankle a little bit on today's run so clearly, I need more work.
customer_reviews.author: L. Lederer

customer_reviews.title: A little stiff to be used as a kneel pad, but great quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to kneel on while working on my vehicles. Dedicated rectangular kneel pads seemed too thin to provide adequate padding. This is the perfect thickness, but seems a bit too stiff. It definitely is better than kneeling on concrete, but I had hoped it would be softer. I guess it’s intended to balance on, so the stiffness is desirable for that purpose. The pad has been durable so far, and even is resistant to oil spills in the garage. The size is great as a kneel pad too.
customer_reviews.author: Pidasso

customer_reviews.title: More than one use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product for my home therapy after a 1.5 months ago. I added this for at home therapy because my physical therapist showed me a few great stability exercises with using this pad and two wobble cushions (which I already have at home for core strength). I am very happy with this product and would definitely recommend it, whether you are adding this for stability exercise(s) program or an elevation while sitting.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SUPER QUALITY AND SUPER SIZE
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool. This is great for balanceing, which will take me some time but its also good for other things like sitting on it on the floor for stretching. Its comfortable on the bum and raises the backs of your legs off the floor to get a deeper stretch. You can figure out many things to use it for. Even for laying it on your lap when your in bed to put your device on or lay and open book. I just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Mohini

customer_reviews.title: Wish I Bought This A Year Ago!
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic!!!! So much support for recovering from injured MCL and just general knee aches as I age 😫😫 lol. I use it for yoga and also just occasionally when I need to crawl around on the floor for some reason and rain, etc. has my knees aching. I’m plus size (18 pants) and it holds up extremely well. Very sturdy. Wish I had bought it a year ago!
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Y.

customer_reviews.title: Bands did not arrive!
customer_reviews.text: The pad seems sturdy enough and the thickness is good. I’m highly disappointed though because I didn’t receive the resistance bands that are advertised to come with the pad I ordered. One star for the false advertisement and/or the incomplete order.
customer_reviews.author: AYC23

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Rehab After Stroke
customer_reviews.text: After careful research and recommendations from my physical therapist, I chose this product. It is perfect for my three-times-a-day "homework" between rehab sessions. It is very challenging to stand with my eyes closed after having a stroke, but necessary to retrain my brain how to do this. Place it in a corner at home, not in the middle of the room. Keep your feet together, cross your arms over your chest, focus on an object and then shut your eyes. I'm up to 17 seconds most of the time before I have to reach out for the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra G Asher

customer_reviews.title: I have difficulty finding a comfortable place to rest it
customer_reviews.text: My trainer loves doing hip bridges with me with a ridiculously heavy bar. I have difficulty finding a comfortable place to rest it, so I bought this pad after seeing a YouTube video and gave it to him to use with me and other clients. He has some elderly clients, so I imagine he'll have lots of ways to use this. It helps me so much on leg day to have this extra padding so I can focus on form.
customer_reviews.author: K Kaufman

customer_reviews.title: but the YES4ALL has been incredibly good to me
customer_reviews.text: I'm a HUGE believer in foam pads, but the YES4ALL has been incredibly good to me. Let alone extremely affordable that offers all that my Physical Therapist recommend after having kneee and feet injuries for sometime. I am a huge Marathoner who is extremely active, although have found that over many years that my balance isn't so great so using this for now almost a month has been extremely rewarding seeing major changes in my running and recovery to being pain free and building much more strength around those problem areas from the hip all the way to the foot! Thank you so very much!!
customer_reviews.author: lydia marie

customer_reviews.title: A Bit Too Firm for Me
customer_reviews.text: I decided to return the item. The problem for me was that it was too firm to serve its purpose as a balance pad, i.e., not enough of a challenge. Maybe it was just a matter of taste, like a shirt that is just a bit too loose. Otherwise there were no problems. If I were shopping in a store, I never would have bought. It is one of few downsides to online shopping. But on the bright side, Amazon makes returns super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Dallas Sub Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Good for learning to balance oneself.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t address durability or stability as I haven’t had it long, and if I was stable myself, I wouldn’t be using it. I have a very hard time with body stability and balance, so my PT suggested I buy the pad. Since it’s not used by dozens of people, she said this pad would be fine, and it is. It serves the purpose just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Y Me?

customer_reviews.title: Love this foam pad!
customer_reviews.text: I use a riser to do push ups so it’s not as hard on my wrists in my exercise class - and I bought this so I could work out at home during the Coronavirus lockdown. It’s been great! It’s sturdy, lightweight, easy to use. My only complaint is the material - I get really sweaty when I exercise and the material of this pad is easy to slip on. I’ve been putting a t-shirt over it to keep my hands stable on it while I do push ups so I’m not slipping around. That’s my only complaint though. Other than that, love!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie

customer_reviews.title: Very useful mat for PT
customer_reviews.text: I had lapiplasty foot surgery a few weeks ago. My foot is still healing. This mat is very similar to the one that is used at my physical therapy place. I bought it to do my at home PT. It’s been helping with my foot mobility. Very cushiony and easy on my foot, I appreciate that.
customer_reviews.author: Somewhere in TX

customer_reviews.title: Light weight,  stable.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dog training. It is very light weight but solid. It is good for small dog training.
customer_reviews.author: PGlenn

customer_reviews.title: Effective Balance Pad
customer_reviews.text: This balance pad is exactly like the one I used at physical therapy and is helping this senior to improve balance and minimize the chances of falling. It is lightweight and also is a lovely shade of purple.
customer_reviews.author: Louise M Houghtaling

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: My husband had stroke the years ago and although he's recovered well his balance remains weak. The doctor recommended we get a balance pad. This has been the best piece of his recovery equipment. Thank you for a quality product. He's doing great with it.
customer_reviews.author: Corinna

customer_reviews.title: Great for balance
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in my home gym. This pad is great for building balance and rehabbing my ankle after a bad ankle sprain. The only knock on it is the durability. After putting something heavy on the pad for a short time, there was a deep cut in the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: This product looks and feels exactly like the canine product
customer_reviews.text: When looking for a balance pad for my conformation show dogs, I was -shocked- at the price the "canine specific" equipment was going for. So, I looked into human alternatives. This product looks and feels exactly like the canine product, and has held up to dogs ranging from ten to forty-five pounds. The material is soft, however, so dog nails definitely can do a number on the surface if they're long/sharp. Overall, product works as expected and is holding up well!
customer_reviews.author: C. Morris

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for Hip Thrusts
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I bought this for hip thrusts to help pad my bar when lifting. I have a barbell pad but even with that, it hurt too much to do hip thrusts. The balance pad is perfect and alleviates all discomfort.

customer_reviews.title: Multi-functional
customer_reviews.text: We have this out in the yard at the end of our daughter’s slide for a landing pad. It is super thick, so it cushions her butt well. It is holding up to the elements (rain, being on the ground, bugs) even though this is not its intended purpose. As far as stability training, I can see how it would be amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Black1304

customer_reviews.title: Thick and soft enough, but not sure About it’s durability
customer_reviews.text: Soft, thick foam pad similar to mats used in PT gyms but already showing small pieces missing and have only used about 15x with clients-not sure it’s as durable as I’d hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Clarice  Cummins,PT

customer_reviews.title: Great pad and seems to hold up!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this pad for 7 months and use it to stand on when I do my balancing exercises. It feels great on my feet and has held up well. I highly recommend it! Good price too!
customer_reviews.author: barb d

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful
customer_reviews.text: My Physical Therapist sent me the link to help with ordering this product. I have Achilles tendonitis issues. Using this pad is a great exercise to help with stabilizing my foot. It's been amusing to see how poor my balance is. The Therapist told me to do 10 sets of 10 seconds on each foot. Can't get to 10 seconds, yet.
customer_reviews.author: MaryIM

customer_reviews.title: It works great for strengthening ankles and balance.
customer_reviews.text: I recently broke my ankle, this is one of the tools the physical therapist used to help strengthen my ankle. I am finished with therapy now and got one of these to continue on my own. I use it for both ankle and to help with my balance. I like to hike, backpack and do yoga, this will help me with my balance and has already given me better ankle strength.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product to help me with my knee exercises to help strengthen my knees and alleviate my knee pain. Very well constructed. Dimensions are also very good with regard to height, width and length. Thickness provides just the right cushioning. Would recommend this product to others
customer_reviews.author: Happily retired guy

customer_reviews.title: Bought after physical therapy
customer_reviews.text: Got this after completing physical therapy! Physical Therapist recommended that I purchase this to continue to do my therapeutic exercises at home and that getting one that was name brand at $60 was a waste of money. This has the same consistency as the one I used and the same size.
customer_reviews.author: Perezj

customer_reviews.title: Great for physical therapy
customer_reviews.text: I had an injury and saw a physical therapist. I used one at my appointments, so I got one to use at home and it really helped to strengthen my knees and ankles. I still use it.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Nice Balance Pad
customer_reviews.text: Nice strong balance pad. While recovering from a hip injury this type of pad was used at the physical therapy office. I purchased this one so I could continue to do the exercises at home. It is also a great pad for using while doing various stretching exercises. Good solid cover that won't break down fast.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce B.

customer_reviews.title: Effective
customer_reviews.text: I first encountered these pads at the physical therapist's office when I was recovering from a knee injury. I liked it so much I bought one for home. I use it every day in my morning exercise routine. My balance and strength has improved. I also like to stand on it when I'm working in the kitchen for longer periods.
customer_reviews.author: KT_city

customer_reviews.title: Good but durability poor
customer_reviews.text: Product works as good as an Airex. I can tell the durability is trash though. I like accidentally stepped on an edge and it’s already coming apart a little. The function is good though
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: This is a great balance pad
customer_reviews.text: This is a great balance pad. Works as well as the one in the PT's office. It would also be very nice for kneeling on for anyone that has bad knees and wants to do exercises that involve kneeling or gardening work. Might make a good stadium seat cushion too. It's a dense quality foam material and PURPLE!
customer_reviews.author: oodles

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product had to keep telling my son not to jump up and down on it as he was going to break it and he did crack it. This is the problem with young kids. I use this for my ab roller
customer_reviews.author: Steven C.

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great relief. I even take it to yoga class ...
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist had one of these in her office. I recently dislocated my knee and lots of the exercises in therapy are done on all fours but the injure knee can't take the pressure. This has been a great relief. I even take it to yoga class with me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No complaints. This is a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I’m really happy with the large pad. It’s great for improving balance as everyone has stated, but has also worked well as a stand pad for my standup desk. I am 5’2, 138 lbs. For someone my weight and size the large pad is nice and durable. I am also using it as a small step pad to get into bed sometimes because the bed is a few inches too high for my hips. I bought purple.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Riot

customer_reviews.title: Excellent in every way
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I can help my elderly mother work on her balance. She has a major problem with her balance and this is perfect. Not too firm, not soft. Just right. She can step up and off of it without fear. Perfect size, too. Not so big that she could stumble, but large enough that she has to step out just a bit. Really excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Irene's mom

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for Sitting and Balancing
customer_reviews.text: I have a back pain that keeps me from sitting comfortably on the ground while exercising. This pad was just what I needed. It’s firm, yet padded and has enough give for you to sit comfortably. I also use it for balancing exercises to strengthen my ankles. If you’re not already well-balanced, you may find this difficult to use for that purpose; but with practice it should come easier.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Keke

customer_reviews.title: who knew !
customer_reviews.text: just like the one at the Physical Therapist office, without the embarrassment of falling down in public. Who knew something so simple could help build back my balance ! Then I will be using it in the garden for my knees ! Oh yeah !!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Could Have More Springiness, Good for Beginner
customer_reviews.text: This is good, maybe it gets better with time. A little too stiff. If it had more rubbery give it would be better for balancing. It's good for a beginner. It can also front for other uses (knees for gardening or any kind of kneeling work around the house)
customer_reviews.author: Dennis BarringtonTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Very nice balance pad
customer_reviews.text: It is very nice to do single leg balancing on it. Just the right amount of instability, not very challenging. It sunk less than an inch under my foot. I like its soft feeling under my barefoot. And it resumes its original shape after use. I use it in front of my standing desk during work from home. It is too hard to be used as a seat cushion. Don't know how long it will last, though.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Tang

customer_reviews.title: Yes4All Balance Foam Pad is everything they say it is
customer_reviews.text: The foam pad has enough spring that it forces you to get into really solid balance, otherwise, you'll quickly lose it, and fall over: you can't cheat. The thickness is good.
customer_reviews.author: RIppolito

customer_reviews.title: Seems just as good as the one I use in physical therapy for my ankle
customer_reviews.text: I use one like this at physical therapy for my sprained ankle rehab, and this one is just as good. Probably just as helpful as the Bosu ball for my rehab, but at a serious fraction of the price - I don't know why those things are so expensive: they are just have of a balance ball!
customer_reviews.author: GeekyPhotogMomSings

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I use it for
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to be used as a seat cushion because I am very tall and when I fly on airplanes I have to get my hips up higher and it works on these long flights. Feels kind of silly going to the airport caring my seat cushion but it works
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for improving leg strength and balance
customer_reviews.text: I love this foam pad. I use it to work on my balance for kicking (karate). It strengthens my leg and hip muscles while improving my balance. I wish it came in a larger option then XL.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Schilling

customer_reviews.title: Double use for me. It’s great
customer_reviews.text: My OT places it under the sofa cushion to give stable height and I use coccyx gel cushion on top of sofa cushion. Will use it for balance when I’m to that stage of rehab
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent! Therapists had me standing on these while recovering ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! Therapists had me standing on these while recovering from a stroke, and it was a HUGE aid to my balance. I decided to pick one up and make it a regular part of daily exercises, and I'm glad I did. It's every bit as good as the ones in the therapy office.
customer_reviews.author: David McDowell

customer_reviews.title: Nice balance pad
customer_reviews.text: It's what I expected, so that's a good thing. Solid foam pad. Sturdy but with "cushion" so the dog has to "work". I only rated durability lower because I expect with use the dog's nails will take a toll on the cushion.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Effective Tool
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was recommended by my chiropractor due to a hip injury after a knee replacement. He felt I needed to work on balance so my body could correct for the new replacement. It has worked and I am walking more quickly and feeling much better. This was an inexpensive and easy to use tool to help with balance and recovery. It is not a bad seat cushion either.
customer_reviews.author: Bassplr

customer_reviews.title: Same as Airex
customer_reviews.text: This is as close to an Airex pad as you need. No need to pay 3x more. If you are not familiar with an Airex pad, it is somewhere between a foam yoga block and memory foam. Great for stability work and for kneeling or half kneeling exercise.
customer_reviews.author: vanb

customer_reviews.title: Holding Up Well to Lots of Use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for about a year, to do some physical therapy on, and it's held up great. Very happy. It's got the right density, I think.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick at a good price
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the foam in this pad seems really good, with just enough give to make balancing exercises nice and challenging, but resilient in recovering its shape after use. The XL is large enough to allow heel to toe exercises, all at a good price. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: PeterD

customer_reviews.title: Good for most persons
customer_reviews.text: This is great for someone who has little balance to moderate balance problems. The construction is sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use something like this at physical therapy for balance
customer_reviews.text: I use something like this at physical therapy for balance. I used to have wonderful balance but as I aged and had injuries it shocked me how bad I was using one of these. I now can work on balance at home so increase my core strength and decrease injuries.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Used to work on balance. Just arrived. Well-constructed and without defects. This is the first balance pad I have used, so I have nothing to compare it to. But I am quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Perpetually-Perfect

customer_reviews.title: Great for exercising my ankle after a sprain
customer_reviews.text: Great for exercising my ankle after a sprain. Also useful for kneeling on while washing the dogs and for sitting on to keep my but warm from my cast iron patio furniture since said dogs insist I sit outside with them while they conduct their doggy business transactions, even in the winter. But also really good for the ankle thing and for doing squats on to engage the core more.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Boss

customer_reviews.title: Multipurpose Pad
customer_reviews.text: I've used this pad for approximately 6 months and I really like it. I use it for a variety of floor exercises as a cushion for my knees and butt, and it is not too hard or soft. It is invaluable around the house for anything you need get on your knees to do (cleaning, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: D Thies

customer_reviews.title: I was worried the quality might be poor, but I have been using it for months ...
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted and for half the price of the other ones I looked at! I was worried the quality might be poor, but I have been using it for months and it is holding up perfectly. I would definitely recommend this item and buy it again myself. I don't know how it compares to the very 'high end' balance pads, but i think for the price you'll be very happy.
customer_reviews.author: NiNgirl

customer_reviews.title: Great for long periods of standing.
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my standing work station. I'm able to stand on it for up to 5 hours at a time without needing a break or my feet hurting. I also like that I can do mini exercises, such as balancing on one foot, and it gives to my change in standing position. Definitely what I'll buy the next time I need something to stand on for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Great for speaker isolation
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these to isolate my main speakers from the floor working fine.
customer_reviews.author: M Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great pad for balance
customer_reviews.text: Great balance pad. Stays in place. Durable, no cracking in spite of some heavy people using it. Excellent tool for building stronger balance reactions.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Langevin

customer_reviews.title: Soft, squishy, durable foam
customer_reviews.text: Product is as described and is a nice squishy foam. You can use it for balance or as a soft pad for kneeling. I use it regularly to remain comfortable during the couch stretch, which digs the knee into the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Gigit

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, Multi-purpose Device
customer_reviews.text: I love this pad - which I use for so much more than balance. Iʻm small enough that I can use it for shoulder stand, and itʻs the perfect height. I also do a nice calf stretch on it by letting my heels hang off the back. And itʻs purple!!! :-)
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Polland

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable foam pad I’ve ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This balance foam pad might be the best thing I’ve ever bought in 2019! I can now have thrust like a machine. Seriously the most comfortable phone pad I’ve ever used and you must buy it now.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Jamal

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed - it helps with strengthening with my physical therapy exercises, adds a little bit of wobble so I need to be stronger to do the same exercises I've been doing on flat ground.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M

customer_reviews.title: Nice size
customer_reviews.text: l use it for my exercise classes both for balance and protection of the back during Core workout.
customer_reviews.author: arlene c.

customer_reviews.title: Soft But Resilient--Does Not Easily "Bottom Out"
customer_reviews.text: Great for a foot rest, protecting back/elbows/knees, from hard surface. Soft enough that a broken toe can be used on it as if it were not damaged, etc. Once it is compressed to about halfway, it keeps elbows, etc. from "bottoming out". Great product.
customer_reviews.author: MIT Grad

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It’s perfect for my dad’s wheelchair. It is starting to come apart a little, but we use it daily, so I think that’s to be expected. Very well made.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Lincoln

customer_reviews.title: Quality product for the price
customer_reviews.text: I like having these mats for exercise and to stand on for a prolonged period. It's well made and can take a lot of weight and abuse.
customer_reviews.author: G. Chen

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's not as challenging as an airex, but it hasn't cracked the way airex does.
customer_reviews.author: brianfssc

customer_reviews.title: What a relief!
customer_reviews.text: Bad back, soft chairs...this cushion solves the problem. Now have 4, including one for the car. Get the extra large.
customer_reviews.author: CaptNemo

customer_reviews.title: Not kid proof, but still great
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to have in your tool kit. However even with requiring bare feet or stockinged feet this shows signs of wear quickly.
customer_reviews.author: lauren minichello

customer_reviews.title: Starting to find my balance
customer_reviews.text: In the words of my Chiroprator,” using the balance pad helps to download new programs in your brain for standing walking and balancing.”
customer_reviews.author: Audrey White

customer_reviews.title: The pad is somewhat too dense (or firm). As ...
customer_reviews.text: The pad is somewhat too dense (or firm). As a result, use of the pad is not as challenging to my legs as I had hoped. I am comparing this pad to the pad I used recently in physical therapy.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: I like
customer_reviews.text: I use it for gardening. Best mat around. My old knees say thanks.
customer_reviews.author: gm

customer_reviews.title: The purple is darker than what appears in the picture
customer_reviews.text: Yes, it's not as jiggly as the real expensive one. But if you're not a fitness freak and you want to build up your balance, then this is a good "starter pad" as someone else said in their review. Plus, the purple is a nice, dark shade (not fluorescent.)
customer_reviews.author: MR

customer_reviews.title: Great for tired feet
customer_reviews.text: Don't really use this as a balance tool but use it to stand on in my socks at the end of the day at the bar while watching TV virtually a foot massage.
customer_reviews.author: Pitz

customer_reviews.title: Good balance tool for increased challenge during exercises.
customer_reviews.text: Good for balance training or even just for added cushion on knees when kneeling/exercises. Firmer than I would have liked as I mainly got this for balance training.
customer_reviews.author: Vinegar Strokes

customer_reviews.title: Good quality mat
customer_reviews.text: Almost identical to the mat I bought earlier for $30 from another company, just a bit smaller.
customer_reviews.author: yulia-julia

customer_reviews.title: very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This helps me in some of my exercises to protect my knees
customer_reviews.author: William R. Coffman

customer_reviews.title: Just like the one at my physical therapist's office
customer_reviews.text: My physical therapist recommended this pad. It is less expensive than some others on the market. If it holds up in a PT office with lots of use, it should last me a long time. I find the stiffness and density to be right for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: C. Joyce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pad!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect pad for regaining balance after an accident or any time in one's life. We all need to ensure we are balanced, and this pad is great for that.
customer_reviews.author: trugirl

customer_reviews.title: CPT approved
customer_reviews.text: As a CPT, I love using this for myself and my clients. Building stability and balance to improve quality of life.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Tolentino

customer_reviews.title: does the job well
customer_reviews.text: The pad is good exercise material for my foot and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little stiff but exactly what I needed for balance training
customer_reviews.text: I am recovering from ankle surgery and need this to work on my balance. It's taking a bit to break in as it came very stiff. But holding up well and love the purple
customer_reviews.author: A. Ross

customer_reviews.title: Im satisfied it works perfectly well made
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality & price. It has truly worked perfectly- I’m satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Zobie

customer_reviews.title: Greaat purchase
customer_reviews.text: Recommended by my physical therapist. Nice and dense. I use it under my desk at work to assist with posture. HAS held up so far. Do not recommend putting high heels on it. Heels would probably tear it up.
customer_reviews.author: S. Varney

customer_reviews.title: Great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality....I use for all sorts stretches and balance moves. I have bad knees and I put this under them when I would normally place a pillow for stretches. AMAZING difference. great for balance training and quality of foam is holding up after a years of use. Nice size...not to large and not to small.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: Great for engaging stabilizers and helping overall fitness and health.
customer_reviews.author: CJ Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Exercise and balance
customer_reviews.text: Just want I was looking for. Would buy again. Very comfortable to use
customer_reviews.author: Linda Bentley

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Balance
customer_reviews.text: I went to a PT Eval today and saw four of these spread around. Great for balancing or kneeling!
customer_reviews.author: RPaul

customer_reviews.title: Does not hold up to usage
customer_reviews.text: The price is right and initially I liked it but it quickly developed a tear that is likely to enlarge with further usage. I plan to replace it with a higher quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Hood River Trading

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to protect recipient's knees when kneeling on the ground and this product provides complete relief for them. Found out after purchase that item can also used for exercises to improve balance. Very pleased with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Q Public

customer_reviews.title: Great balance pad, fun color.
customer_reviews.text: Nicely made, love the color. Works as well as more expensive balance pads that just come in boring blue.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy K

product_meta.title: Yes4All Exercise Foam Pad L & XL - Anti-Fatigue Pad for Ankles & Knees (Loop Bands/Straps) for Physical Exercise/Balance, Therapy, Yoga & Fitness
product_meta.description:
PERFECT TOOL FOR BALANCE TRAINING

Yes4All Balance Pad is an excellent stability trainer for all fitness levels, especially designed to also cater for seniors who want to improve balance, coordination, strength, core muscles, motor-skill training, overall stability and help avoid injuries. It is a practical companion exercise pad to increase the difficulty of common exercises like lunges, push-ups, squats, sit-ups, and yoga poses.

REVOLUTIONARY BALANCE PAD

The destabilizing properties of the closed cell EVA Foam make Yes4All Balance Pad an excellent tool to improve motor skills and balance. The Pad comes with tear-resistant feature to provide comfort and superb cushioning. The Balance Pad features with a textured, non-slip surface which avoid slipping and sliding during your practice.

BALANCE PAD SPECIFICATIONS 

 * Available in two sizes: 15.5” L x 13.5” W x 2” H and 19” L x 15” W x 2.25” H
 * Color: Blue, Black, Purple
 * Weight: 1.5 lbs (X-Large size), 0.8 lbs (Large size)
 * Material: High quality closed cell foam sweat proof EVA material


MORE OPTIONS AVAILABLE

Balance Pad (Large Size) & Yoga Strap (8 Feet) combo is now available with 3 color options – Black, Blue & Purple. You can definitely benefit from the balance pad and vary your workouts plus deepen your poses and give yourself effective stretching as well with Yes4All high quality Yoga strap.

Moreover, depending on your preference, you can choose the Balance Pad (Large Size) & Set of 5 Loop Bands to add more variety to you daily workout routine.

WARRANTY:

1-year warranty and 30-day return (contact seller for more details)
feature_bullets: HIGH-QUALITY CLOSED CELL FOAM: Constructed of Super soft and durable EVA foam to add more durability & safety
15. 5” LENGTH X 13. 5” WIDTH X 2” HEIGHT TEXTURED NON-SLIP SURFACE: Textured sweat proof surface provides additional grip, avoid slipping or sliding even in sweaty workouts
VERSATILE BALANCE PAD: Perfect for all ages and fitness levels. Can be used to increase the difficulty of common exercises like, lunges, push-ups, squats, sit-ups, and yoga poses
THERAPEUTIC BENEFITS: Specially designed to increase balance and used in rehab, physical therapy, physio. Perfect for seniors who need something Gentle on their joints

USE AS A CUSHION: The balance pad is lightweight enough to be taken anywhere from house to the office. Therefore, you can also use it as a perfect cushion for knees, seat and elbows to support in any kind of exercises
